alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Camden; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 25 at 4:24PM EDT until July 25 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Camden County in southern New Jersey... Gloucester County in southern New Jersey... West central Burlington County in southern New Jersey... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 424 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mullica Hill, or 10 miles southwest of Gloucester City, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Evesham, Deptford, Voorhees, West Deptford, Glassboro, Lindenwold, Hammonton, Bellmawr, Woodbury, Pitman, Clayton, Berlin, Paulsboro, Magnolia, Westville, Woodbury Heights, National Park, Swedesboro, Brooklawn and Chesilhurst. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 2 and 3. Interstate 76 in New Jersey near mile marker 0. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 12 and 32. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 31 and 44. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
